sentences.en: All sorts of associating the hearsay a temporary clamor of type, around lasted near one year.
sentences.cn: 各种联想式的传言甚嚣尘上, 前后持续了将近一年.

sentences.en: He ignored the clamor of the crowd.
Interoperability closedlock - in, developers clamor for interoperability.
sentences.cn: 可交互性 — 由于大多数当前的云彩提供封闭的平台并且锁定在某个供应商中, 开发人员呼吁交互性.

sentences.en: On weekdays, the marmosets steered clear of the roar of traffic, and on Sundays they shunned the clamor of visiting crowds.
sentences.cn: 工作日的时候，这些狨猴避开嘈杂的交通，星期天的时候它们就会避开喧闹的游客。

sentences.en: Our voices are simply drowned out in the general tumult and clamor.
sentences.cn: 我们的声音被淹没在大众的吵闹和喧哗之中.

sentences.en: So now it is vain for the singer to burst into clamor.
sentences.cn: 那歌手的激烈地叫喊,那黑色大钢琴的热情.

sentences.en: The clamor of the traffic gave me a headache.
The clamor of traffic gave me a headache.
The clamor of traffic has receded to a distant murmur.
sentences.cn: 车辆的喧闹声已渐渐远去，变得模糊起来。

sentences.en: The debate was interrupted by a clamor of opposition.
sentences.cn: 辩论被反对方的一声叫喊打断.
会议在一阵喧嚣声中结束.

sentences.en: The public clamor for lower taxes continued year after year.
sentences.cn: 民众大声疾呼,要求逐年减税.

sentences.en: The public clamor should not be ignored.
sentences.cn: 大众的吵闹声不应该被忽视.

sentences.en: There was a clamor of voices outside the office.
sentences.cn: 办公室外有人吵吵嚷嚷。

sentences.en: There was a great clamor of squawks and screes from the crowd when first he moved.
sentences.cn: 他刚一动弹,鸥群中就嘎嘎、嘎嘎地嚷起来.

sentences.en: Zefter reeled as if she were intoxicated, overwhelmed by the clamor and congestion.
sentences.cn: 泽弗特尔摇摇晃晃地走着,好象喝醉了酒似的.她已经被嘈杂的声音和拥挤的人群闹得晕头转向了.

words.tran_cn: 吵闹的；喧嚷的；紧急的；非常需要注意的

trans.tran_cn: 喧哗声，喧闹，大声的要求或抗议
喧哗，吵闹，大声地要求或抗议
